column4: Well if someone can help im learning ubuntu on an old pc and it has a GeForce4 Ti 4200 graphics card ubuntu does not properly pick it up and forces me to stay in 640x480 is there linux drivers for this card that i can use?
can you post your xorg.conf file?
/etc/X11/xorg.conf post it to a pastebin and give me a link
http://pastebin.ca/
you getting it?
http://pastebin.ca/835331
you only have that resolution declard in your xorg.conf
have you modified this file yourself at all or is the one that was made when you installed ubuntu?
has it ever worked before?
i mean has it ever worked with any other resolution, to be honest, it looks like something has editted that file, its working, but strangely formatted
ok, what im gonn have you do is back up your old config file, then re-generate a new one, hopefully getting it going
open a terminal and execute the following: "cd /etc/X11/
sudo mv xorg.conf xorg.conf.bak
sudo dexconf
let me konw when you do all of that
did you do the dexconf as root?
do "sudo dexconf"
now pastebin your xorg.conf file again and give me the link
it successfully re-wrote your config file, you now have resolutions 1024X768, 800X600, and 640X480
now you have to restart the x server to see t he changes, do CTRL+ALT+BACKSPACE, but note, its going to log you out of the system and then you will have to log back in
no problem at all
